experience: Mike can introduce you to 8 people at Oracle
Mike can introduce you to 4 people at Flathead County
Systems Business Analyst - Bioastronautics/Health and Human Performance Information Technology
KBRwyle Technology and Engineering – NASA /Johnson Space Center

My tenure at KBRwyle/NASA includes serving as both a systems administrator, with an emphasis in ESXi/VMWare virtual servers and EMC storage technologies, as well as an agile business analyst for the Health and Human Performance Directorate /International Space Station projects.  •	EMC Enterprise Storage Administrator, NetBackup, VSphere ESXi, Windows                        Server - all flavors.•	McAfee Vulnerability Manager (MVM); IT Security Vulnerability Reduction                   Working Group /AVAR (Agency Vulnerability and Remediation) program.

Server and infrastructure support for upwards of 5,000 student residents and staff.  Service and technical support for university activities, concert and sporting functions.  Areas of concentration were all servers, backup and storage administration, active directory, routing, firewall/VPN administration, wireless technologies, security and camera systems, and systems vulnerability management.•	Technical lead for all servers, Active Directory, network infrastructure, and communications•	P2V deployments /Green IT sustainability initiative•	Cyber security, Copyright infringements, continuous monitoring•	Project manager and technical lead for camera and security installation•	Project manager and technical lead for Commvault backups•	Project and technical manager for Auxiliary Services Qualys Vulnerability Management

At LexisNexis I provided full technical support for the Bridger Insight XG software suite, using Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software (Right Now) and, SQL Server.  Support to private and government entities requiring effective due diligence and compliance with government background regulations surrounding people security within the Customer Identification Program (CIP), (Know Your Customer (KYC), FACTA (FACT Act), the USA PATRIOT ACT, Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC), Bank Secrecy Act (BSA), and INTERPOL.

Network and systems manager for Optio Solutions and backup Systems Administrator for CrossCheck, Inc., includes the headquarters office and their independent sales offices in Dallas, Houston and Phoenix.  Full support for all Windows Servers, including PDC, BDC, RDC, virtual, Exchange 2010 admin, backup, firewall/SPAM administrator and Symantec anti-virus and vulnerability and security management.

• Project and business design and analysis / (adult) Offender Management Information Systems (OMIS) and Youth Management Information Systems (YMIS)• National chairman of the National Consortium for Offender Management Systems (NCOMS) Business Analyst Group• 2009 recipient of the State of Montana Governors Award for excellence in performance.

Enterprise Systems Administrator who supported all state agencies and their Network Administrators throughout the state of Montana.  As a third-tier systems, directory, and network manager,  performed server and directory upgrades for both the states Novell Directory Service (NDS) and Active Directory.• The state of Montana’s Windows and Citrix disaster recovery planner. This included both full system restores and scratch builds of the state’s Active Directory, Citrix Metaframe, roaming profile, and Microsoft Exchange Server environments in partnership with Weyerhaeuser and SunGard Recovery Systems.
Provided second tier software support for 300+ workstation clients statewide. Software Support team for State Fund help desk.MS Access Developer.
Butte Literacy Council, taught GED level math to offenders needing a GED as a condition of release
